relevantSources.title: Cybersecurity - United Airlines Corporate Impact Report 2024
relevantSources.summary: United describes responsible AI framework supporting ethical, transparent and accountable AI use

Transparency.findings: United Airlines mentions having a "Responsible AI framework" that supports transparency, but provides no concrete details about implementation methods, model cards, or specific transparency practices. The company acknowledges transparency as a principle in their Corporate Impact Report and SEC filings, but lacks publicly accessible artifacts that demonstrate detailed, verifiable transparency measures. While the commitment to transparency is stated, there is no evidence of specific transparency tools, dashboards, or detailed documentation that would constitute concrete evidence.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Cybersecurity - United Airlines Corporate Impact Report 2024
relevantSources.summary: United states commitment to using AI responsibly with prioritizing fairness, transparency and accountability in AI operations

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: United Airlines explicitly mentions fairness as a core principle in their AI operations within their Corporate Impact Report. However, the documentation provides only high-level commitments without detailing specific bias mitigation methods, fairness metrics, or testing procedures. The company acknowledges the importance of fairness in AI deployment but has not published concrete evidence of bias-testing methodologies, disparate impact analyses, or third-party fairness audits.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: United Safety Management System
relevantSources.summary: Describes collaboration between Digital Technology, Safety teams using AI with human oversight for safety solutions

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: United Airlines demonstrates some commitment to human oversight through their Safety Management System, which describes collaboration between Digital Technology and Safety teams in AI deployment. However, the documentation lacks specific details about formal oversight committees, appeals processes, or structured human-in-the-loop workflows. While human oversight is mentioned in the context of safety operations, there is no evidence of dedicated AI ethics boards, specific review procedures, or customer-facing appeal mechanisms for AI-driven decisions.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Cybersecurity - United Airlines Corporate Impact Report 2024

Privacy & Security.findings: United Airlines addresses privacy and security through their Corporate Impact Report and Digital Trust Center, mentioning data protection measures and privacy rights management. The company acknowledges the importance of data protection in AI systems but provides limited specific details about AI training data collection, consent mechanisms, or anonymization procedures. While general privacy commitments are evident, the documentation lacks concrete information about encryption standards, AI-specific data handling procedures, or detailed privacy practices that would constitute comprehensive evidence.

relevantSources.title: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC. Audit Committee Charter

Governance & Accountability.findings: United Airlines demonstrates some AI governance structure through CISO-led oversight and Board involvement as mentioned in their Corporate Impact Report. The Audit Committee Charter provides evidence of governance oversight for technology risks, which may include AI systems. However, the documentation lacks specific details about dedicated AI governance offices, specialized AI ethics teams, or detailed budget allocations for responsible AI initiatives. While governance structures exist at a high level, there is insufficient evidence of comprehensive, AI-specific governance frameworks with detailed organizational charts or dedicated responsible AI personnel.

summary.overallFindings: United Airlines Holdings, Inc. demonstrates high-level commitments to responsible AI principles such as transparency, fairness, privacy, and governance in its public disclosures, particularly through its Corporate Impact Report and select regulatory filings. However, the company provides only general statements and lacks detailed, verifiable documentation or concrete evidence for any of the seven Responsible AI pillars. There are significant gaps in explainability, public commitments, and external audits, and no pillar achieves a full evidence score. Overall, United Airlines is at an early stage of public responsible AI maturity, with foundational principles stated but little detailed implementation transparency.
